name: scan-result-rcS_init_script
description: A comprehensive scan of the `etc/init.d/rcS` file revealed no hardcoded credentials or sensitive information. The file content primarily consists of system initialization scripts, including mount commands, directory creation, and service startup instructions.

name: scan-result-rt_tables_config
description: The file `etc/iproute2/rt_tables` contains mappings between routing table numbers and names, with no apparent hardcoded credentials or sensitive information detected. The content primarily consists of network routing configurations, including reserved values (local, main, default) and some custom routing table names (edu, cmc, cnc, etc.).
notes: Although no sensitive information was found, it is recommended to regularly review such network configuration files to ensure no accidental disclosure of internal network structure information.

name: scan-result-udev_config
description: Only the udev.conf configuration file was found in the etc/udev directory. Analysis shows this file contains no hardcoded credentials or sensitive information. The file content solely consists of configuration parameters for udev log levels.

name: scan-result-mdev_config

name: scan-result-ld_so_config
